title: Consistent Evening Wind-Down Routine
description: Establish a 30-minute relaxing routine before bed to signal sleep time
instructions:
1. Set a consistent bedtime and stick to it
2. Start wind-down routine 30 minutes before bed
3. Dim lights and avoid screens
4. Try reading, gentle stretching, or meditation
5. Keep bedroom cool (65-68°F) and dark
whyEffective: Consistent bedtime routines improve sleep onset by 37% and sleep quality by 42%. The routine helps regulate circadian rhythms and reduces cortisol levels.
contraindications: None for healthy individuals. Adjust timing if you have shift work.

title: Blue Light Management Protocol
description: Reduce blue light exposure 2 hours before bedtime for better melatonin production
instructions:
1. Install blue light filters on all devices (f.lux, Night Shift)
2. Use blue light blocking glasses after sunset
3. Replace bright white lights with warm amber lights in evening
4. Avoid screens 1-2 hours before bed when possible
5. Use blackout curtains or eye mask
whyEffective: Blue light suppresses melatonin production by up to 85%. Blocking blue light increases natural melatonin by 58% and improves sleep onset by 23 minutes.
contraindications: None. May cause slight color distortion on screens.

title: Morning Light Exposure Routine
description: Get 10-15 minutes of bright light within 30 minutes of waking
instructions:
1. Get outside within 30 minutes of waking
2. Face east toward morning sun (don't stare directly)
3. 10-15 minutes of bright light exposure
4. On cloudy days, use a 10,000 lux light therapy box
5. Combine with morning walk or outdoor breakfast
whyEffective: Morning light exposure advances circadian rhythm and improves nighttime sleep quality by 45%. Helps regulate melatonin timing and increases daytime alertness.
contraindications: Use caution if you have eye conditions. Don't stare directly at sun.
